  6. Gulf specification conformity form (UAE standards test) If the vehicle was not compliant with GCC specifications.
  7. A letter from the governmental body addressed to the Vehicle Licensing Department, signed by the authorized signatory and stamped by the government entity
  8. Electronic insurance of the vehicle valid for 6 months or more.

For commercial companies and owners of fleets and facilities

  1. Traffic file of the company, establishment or facility
  2. Letter from the establishments, companies or dealers + copy of the commercial license
  3. Vehicle customs card issued from one of the country’s customs departments.
  4. Transfer Certificate from other emirates, or possession certificate issued by the Licensing Agency, if If the vehicle was imported from a party other than the authorised dealer in the following cases:
    1. If the vehicle was imported in the name of a person, it can be registered with the customs card issued from any UAE emirate
    2. If the vehicle was imported by an establishment, it must be transferred from the emirate where the establishment is located to Dubai
  5. Electronic or physical selling agreement between the seller and buyer approved by the system
  6. Gulf specification conformity form (UAE standards test) If the vehicle was not compliant with GCC specifications.
  7. Electronic insurance of the vehicle valid for 6 months or more.

For political and diplomatic bodies

  1. Traffic file of the Diplomatic or political body
  2. A letter for Ministry of Foreign Affairs
  3. Vehicle customs card issued from one of the country’s customs departments.
  4. Transfer Certificate from other emirates, or possession certificate issued by the Licensing Agency, if If the vehicle was imported from a party other than the authorised dealer in the following cases:
    1. If the vehicle was imported in the name of a person, it can be registered with the customs card issued from any UAE emirate
    2. If the vehicle was imported by an establishment, it must be transferred from the emirate where the establishment is located to Dubai
  5. Vehicle test certificate if the vehicle was inspected outside the UAE, used, or imported from a source other than the local dealer
  6. Gulf specification conformity form (UAE standards test) If the vehicle was not compliant with GCC specifications.
  7. Electronic insurance of the vehicle valid for 6 months or more.

For international organization operating inside the UAE

  1. Customer’s traffic file
  2. Original Emirates ID + copy of the passport
  3. A letter for the ministry of Foreign Affairs
  4. Vehicle customs card issued from one of the country’s customs departments.
  5. Transfer Certificate from other emirates, or possession certificate issued by the Licensing Agency, if If the vehicle was imported from a party other than the authorised dealer in the following cases:
    1. If the vehicle was imported in the name of a person, it can be registered with the customs card issued from any UAE emirate
    2. If the vehicle was imported by an establishment, it must be transferred from the emirate where the establishment is located to Dubai
  6. Electronic or physical selling agreement between the seller and buyer approved by the system
  7. Vehicle test certificate if the vehicle was inspected outside the UAE, used, or imported from a source other than the local dealer
  8. Gulf specification conformity form (UAE standards test) If the vehicle was not compliant with GCC specifications.
  9. Electronic insurance of the vehicle valid for 6 months or more.

name: Apply for Renewing a Driving License

fields.Process:
Through the website

  • The customer undergoes an eye test at one of the eye test centres
  • The customer pays the fines
  • The customer applies for renewing a driving license
  • The customer settles the required fees
  • The customer receives a temporary driving license through the email to print while waiting for the original license which can be delivered through 2 channels:
    • Customer Happiness Centres in Deira or Al Barsha
    • By courier, with an additional fee of 25 AED.

Through the centres or kiosk

  • The customer undergoes an eye test at one of the eye test centres
  • The customer pays the fines
  • The customer applies for renewing a driving license
  • The customer settles the required fees
  • The customer prints the driving license from the centre or kiosk.

Through the call centre

  • The customer contacts the call centre and provides RTA with the driving license number
  • The customer is required to pay the fines by credit card
  • The customer receives a temporary driving license through email while waiting for the original license which can be delivered through 2 channels:
    • Customer Happiness Centres in Deira or Al Barsha
    • By courier, with an additional fee of 25 AED.

Through the eye test centres

  • The customer is required to pay all the due fines
  • The customer receives a temporary driving license through email while waiting for the original license which can be delivered through 2 channels:
    • Customer Happiness Centres in Deira or Al Barsh
    • By courier, with an additional fee of 25 AED.

Note: The validity of the temporary license varies between 5 and 15 days.
fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: If the customer is on visit visa and has an expired Dubai driving license, can he renew the driving license?

Answer 1: No, the customer must have a valid Emirates ID card.

  • Question 2: If the driving license is issued in Dubai and the visa is from another emirate, can the customer renew the driving license online?

Answer 2: Yes, the customer can renew the license online after making sure that all the details of the traffic file are updated on the traffic system according to the new residence visa.

  • Question 3: If the customer submits the photo to the optician and does the renewal online, which photo will appear on the new driving license?

Answer 3: As per the policy, only the Emirates ID photo will be used. However, if the said photo was not extracted for a certain reason, the customer can use a photo from the General Directorate of Residency and Foreigners Affairs, a picture from the camera or can even scan any other photo.

  • Question 4: What is the procedure in case there are missing information when applying for the license?

Answer 4: If the customer applies for the license online with missing information or documents, the office team sends him an SMS to provide the details.


SMS Content: Dear customer, kindly provide us with your passport copy including your valid visa to complete your transaction. Fax number: 04 2036679 or email: elham.alfarsi@rta.ae . Thank you from RTA.

  • Question 5: What is the procedure in case the police cancels or suspends a driving license after reaching 24 black points?

Answer 5: The customer goes to Dubai Police to request an NOC letter so that RTA can open a new training file for the customer to be able to take the test again.

  • Question 6: Is it possible to renew or add a category to a military driving license?

Answer 6: No, the customer must visit the concerned authority to add a category or renew the military license.

  • Question 7: What is the procedure in case the customer’s driving license was confiscated by Dubai police for whatever reason and the customer was asked to refer to the authority to solve the problem?

Answer 7: The customer is sent to Barsha Licensing Centre or Deira Licensing Centre.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The validity of the medical test is 6 months from the date of issuance.
  • All fines must be paid.
  • In case the customer is 21 years old and above, the driving license can be renewed 6 months before the expiry date.
  • In case the customer is less than 21 years old, the license can be renewed 1 month before the expiry date.
  • The driving license to be renewed must be effective and with its owner.
  • Temporary or periodic driving licenses cannot be renewed.
  • The customer’s photograph will be scanned by the Emirates ID scanner.
fields.Validity:
• Below 21 Years old: 1 Year
  • Above 21 years old: 10 years for citizens and 5 years for resident, and GCC citizens.

name: Apply for Renewing a Permanent Parking Permit for People of Determination

fields.Channels - Customer Happiness Centres:
• Customer Happiness Centre - Umm Ramool
  • Customer Happiness Centre - Al Manarah
fields.Process:
Through the website

  • The customer logs in to RTA website and chooses "Permanent Permit for People of Determination" service
  • The customer fills in the requested details and submits the required documents
  • The customer receives RTA reply (approval or rejection) through SMS after 5 working days
  • In case of approval the customer receives the permit through the courier company without any extra charges.

Through customer happiness centres

  • The customer submits the required documents
  • The customer receives the printed permit on the same day.
fields.Output: Parking permit for People of Determination.
fields.Service Fees: • This service is free.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The permit is valid in Dubai only
  • The customer who has the permit must be inside the vehicle when using the parking spot or else a fine will be issued.
fields.Required Documents:
Through RTA website

  1. Copy of Emirates ID or valid Marsoom or valid ID for citizens
  2. Original "People of determination" card issued by the Ministry of Community Development or "Sanad Card" issued by the Community Development Authority or a not-more than 6 month-old medical report indicating the customer's health condition
  3. Copy of the passport
  4. Personal photograph of the customer.

Through customer happiness centres

Customers with "People of Determination" card or "Sanad Card"

  1. Copy of the "People of Determination" card issued by the Ministry of Community Development or "Sanad Card" issued by the Community Development Authority
  2. Original Emirates ID.

Customers without "Sanad Card" or "People of Determination" card

Citizens

  1. Original Emirates ID
  2. Not-more than 3 month-old medical report indicating the customer's health condition.

Resident

  1. Copy of the passport
  2. Copy of the residence visa issued in Dubai
  3. Original Emirates ID
  4. Not-more than 3 month-old medical report indicating the customer's health condition.
fields.Eligibility: Citizens and residents with determination are eligible to apply for this service.
fields.Description: This service enables you to apply for the renewal of a parking permit for people of determination.

name: Apply for Renewing a Safari Driving Permit

fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: What are the details pertaining to driving violations in the desert?

Answer 1: For details about driving violations in the desert without a permit, the customer is requested to check with the Department of Tourism and Commerce Marketing and Dubai Police (Department of Tourism Security).
fields.Channels - Driving Institutes:
• Belhasa Driving Institute
  • Emirates Driving Institute
  • Galadari Motor Driving Centre
  • Al Ahli Driving Centre.
fields.Output: Renewed safari driving permit.
fields.Service Fees:
• 300 AED permit fees
  • +20 AED Knowledge and Innovation fees.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The residents must be sponsored by a tourism company.
  • The customer must be 21 years old and above.
  • The customer must have a valid driving license issued in UAE for a minimum of 2 years
  • The customer must be medically fit (Must have a valid eye test results)
  • The customer must pass the training program for tourist guide (Safari) by the Department of Tourism and Commerce Marketing.
fields.Process:
Through driving institutes

  • The customer get the No Objection Certificate (NOC) to renew a safari driving permit to be able to apply for the training program for tourist guide (Safari) by the Department of Tourism and Commerce Marketing in Dubai
  • The customer passes the training program for tourist guide (Safari) which is valid for 2 years
  • The customer receives a criminal record Certificate electronically from Dubai police and presents it at the institute along with an NOC from the company
  • The employee checks the availability of the eye test results online
  • The customer settles the required fees with the customer happiness employee at the insitute while applying for "Renewing A Safari Driving Permit"
  • The customer receives the new safari driving permit.
fields.Required Documents:
1. Original Emirates ID
  2. No Objection Certificate (NOC) from the tourism company where the customer works
  3. Good Criminal record Certificate.
fields.ELigibility: Individual customers, citizens and residents, who have a safari driving permit issued in Dubai, and work at a tourism company that organize safaris are eligible to apply for this service.
fields.Description: This service enables you to apply for the renewal of a safari driving permit.

name: Apply for Renewing Temporary Outdoor Advertising Permits

fields.Process:
Through website

  • The customer logs in using the username and password
  • The customer chooses the “Right of way advertising services”
  • The customer checks the transaction number to showcase the renewal record
  • The customer chooses the expired transaction number and clicks on Renew
  • The concerned parties at RTA check the request (technical study)
  • The customer receives the approval or the rejection of the request, through the website, email or SMS
  • In case of approval, the customer is required to settle the fees online through the advertising system or by cash through the service centres.
  • The customer prints the permit through the advertising system.

Note: For more information about the approval or the rejection of the request, the customer reviews the Advertising System through the application number.
fields.Validity: The validity varies according to the event and board type.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The customer must receive an approval from the Right of Way Department for traffic diversions and must coordinate with the Roads and Facilities Maintenance section for electrical connections
  • Signs' installation must not conflict with traffic guidance signs or set advertisement signs and must not block the visibility of drivers or affect the pedestrian path
  • Traffic guidance signs installation must not be on sidewalks, footpath and bicycle tracks
  • All advertising boards and flags must be installed not less than the height of the advertisement + 1m from road edge
  • The implementing company holds full responsibility over any damage that results from installing the advertisement. It is also responsible for maintaining and cleaning the boards
  • The customer is prohibited from installing any cutouts or additions or internal lights on the boards without having a permit. If the permit is approved, the lights must be well-fixed on the board
  • The customer must have an approval on the content of the advertisement from the Advertising Section of Dubai Municipality for all types of advertisements
  • The customer must abide by the adopted rules and conditions by the governmental departments and agencies, and must have the necessary approval of all concerned parties
  • The customer receives a preliminary approval for 2 weeks to apply for a No Objection Certificate for permits that require NOCs. The permit is issued after receiving the NOC from the concerned service authorities
  • The customer must have the approval of the Rail Agency for locations that are under its authority (near the route of the metro or the tram)
  • The customer must take all the measures and precautions related to public safety and preventive measures related to the safety of road users while installing, maintaining or removing advertising boards after obtaining the approval of the Right of Way Department for traffic diversions
  • The customer must cooperate with the Advertisement and Investment Services section at the Traffic Department when installing the board to make sure that the installing company is using the location agreed on
  • The customer must remove the advertisement when the permit expires and must leave the location clean as it used to be before
  • The Roads and Transport Authority preserves its right to retract the permit or remove the boards or change their locations should they affect the traffic safety conditions or should they violate the licensing conditions or for any other reasons.

name: Apply for Renewing the Permit to Advertise on Vehicles

fields.Process:
Through website

  • The customer logs in to Website using the username and password
  • The customer selects the "Advertising on Vehicles service"
  • The customer enters the vehicle number or application number
  • The vehicle renewal record shows on screen
  • The customer selects the number of the expired transaction
  • The concerned parties at RTA check the request (technical study)The customer receives the approval or the rejection of the request through the website, email and SMS
  • In case of approval, the customer is required to settle the fees online through the advertising system or by cash through the service centres
  • The customer prints the permit through the advertising system.

Note: For more information about the approval or the rejection of the request, the customer reviews the Advertising System through the application number or vehicle number.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• Arabic language must not be less than 50% of the advertising content
  • Approval from Dubai Police (CID) is required in case of changing the vehicle's original colour
  • In the event of the real estate brokerage/real estate, the customer is required to present a No Objection Certificate from the Dubai Land Department
  • In case the sponsorship is from outside the country the advertisement must be stamped by the ministry of foreign affairs
  • In case of a rented vehicle, the customer is required to present a No Objection Certificate of placing the sticker from the leasing company
  • If the advertisement is for a special product, the customer must present the trademark registration at the Ministry of Economy or the owner's NOC ratified by the notary
  • In case of changing the vehicle's colour for an advertising sticker, the customer must check the Licensing Agency to update the vehicle's information before adding the sticker
  • The following points must be observed when designing the advertisement
    1. Smoking symbols in all their forms are not allowed
    2. Flags of countries are not allowed
    3. Religious slogans or symbols
    4. Images that violate public morality are not allowed
    5. Other languages (excluding Arabic and English) are not allowed
    6. 3D images are not allowed
    7. Images on the front upper part of the vehicle are not allowed
    8. Images of real people are not allowed
  • The advertisement must not include a lot of text
  • The maximum number of images on each side of the vehicle is 4 to 5
  • The customer must pay 100 AED in case of replacing a lost or damaged permit or amending the data of the permit.
  • The advertisement must not be placed on the vehicle windscreen
  • The trade license name must comply with the one stated in the license and vehicle ownership
  • The design must comply with the trade license and vehicle ownership data
  • The company must not write an activity that is not mentioned in the trade license

fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: When was the ownership e-card implemented for individuals?

Answer 1: Phase 1 on January 1, 2018: Government, rental and taxi vehicles.

Phase 2 on May 1, 2018: diplomatic and corporate vehicles.

Phase 3 on September 1, 2018: Individuals vehicles.

  • Question 2: What is ownership e-card and what details it includes?

Answer 2: The ownership e-card is an electronic document called (Vehicle License) sent to the customer via email. It includes all the ownership details including the expiry date, mortgage and insurance. This e-card is issued by the Road and Transport Authority and the customer has to print it or save it on their phone to show it to concerned authorities when needed.

  • Question 3: How can customers print the ownership e-card or any other document in case they didn’t receive an email or they wanted to verify the vehicle details, renewal date and insurance details?

Answer 3: The ownership e-card may be printed as follows:

    • Login to rta.ae.
    • Select Licensing services.
    • Scroll down the Certificate Verification service and press "Click Here".
    • Select service type "Vehicle License" then enter the vehicle details to show the print order.
  • Question 4: What details are featured on the vehicle license?

Answer 4: The vehicle license features all the details related to the vehicle including the expiry date, the mortgage and the insurance details. It is sent via email to the customer in a printable format.

  • Question 5: What happens when police patrols or officers request the ownership card?

Answer 5: The customer shows the ownership e-card featured in RTA applications and saved on his phone, or shows the printed copy of the e-card.

  • Question 6: How does the customer show the e-card to the licensing department?

Answer 6: The customer shows the ownership e-card featured in RTA applications and saved on his phone, or shows the printed copy of the e-card.

  • Question 7: How can the customer access the insurance details?

Answer 7: The insurance details are featured on the ownership e-card accessible through RTA mobile application, or on the printed copy of the vehicle license.

  • Question 8: How can the customer access the mortgage details?

Answer 8: Mortgage details are features on all the documents.

  • Question 9: What happens when the ownership details are amended?

Answer 9: In case any of the vehicle details get amended such as changing the plate number or the color:

- Details are updated on the ownership e-card and the vehicle’s license.

  • Question 10: In case the customer doesn’t have RTA application, can the vehicle license be printed through the customer service centre?

Answer 10: There is no need for the customer service representative to print the vehicle license. The customer may print it through the link sent via email.

  • Question 11: Is the customer obliged to replace the vehicle license once the electronic ownership phase implemented?

Answer 11: The ownership certificate is replaced only upon its renewal, or in case of replacement of lost/damaged license or change in ownership document such as change of color or plate number or adding or redeeming a mortgage.

  • Question 12: In case the customer’s phone number was registered wrongly, how can the link be resent to him?

Answer 12: The customers shall update their personal details though RTA Call Centre: 8009090. Also he can print the ownership e-card as follows:

    • Login to rta.ae.
    • Select Licensing services
    • Scroll down the Certificate Verification service and press "Click Here"
    • Select service type "Vehicle License" then enter the vehicle details to show the print order.
  • Question 13: How can customers check the expiry date of their vehicle license?

Answer 13: The vehicle’s expiry date can be checked in several ways:

    • Through the details featured on the vehicle’s license
    • Through the short messages sent to the customers’ mobile numbers.
  • Question 14: What is required when crossing the borders?

Answer 14:

For UAE and GCC countries:

  • Vehicle license.

If the costumer is not from GCC countries:

  • Vehicle license
  • Tourist certificate
  • Trip ticket.

For other countries:

  • Vehicle license
  • tourist certificate
  • trip ticket.

name: Apply for Renting a Driver without a Vehicle

fields.Process:
• The customer contacts RTA Customer Services
  • The customer submits all required documents
  • The customer signs the contract
  • The customer starts benefiting from the service.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• Service payments are made in advance
  • The hiring Schedule is fixed as per the contract. Any changes should be notified within working hours Sunday to Thursday from 7.30 AM to 2.30 PM.
  • The customer should handle the fuel fees
  • Drivers work on straight shifts, 8 hours per-day, 5 days a week.
  • If drivers exceed the agreed working days or hours, additional proportional charges apply according to the agreed fare value
  • Drivers should undertake not to carry or load any items or materials prohibited by law
  • The customer should undertake not to hire or second the driver to any third parties
  • The First Party (Dubai Taxi Corporation) shall:
    • Provide the required number of drivers and make them at the Second Party’s disposal at the agreed time and location
    • The Hired drivers shall be good looking, experienced and have sufficient knowledge of different sites and locations in the Emirate of Dubai
  • The Second Party (Customer) shall:
    • Submit an unconditional and irrevocable bank guarantee issued by a bank operating in the country, equivalent to 10% of the total agreement value and valid for the duration of the agreement and automatically renewed. Alternatively, the Second Party provides a certified cheque or manager cheque provided that the First party entitled to confiscate the bond value in whole or in part in case of breach by the second party of any of its contractual obligations.
  • Either Party may terminate this agreement any time by giving a prior 30 day notice to the other party if the notified party breached any of its essential contractual obligations.
  • The Second Party undertakes to settle any amounts due to the First Party no later than 7 days as of the date of termination of the agreement
  • Any dispute that arises between parties in relation to the interpretation or execution of the agreement shall be settled amicably and if no amicable settlement was being achieved, the dispute shall be referred to the Courts of Dubai.

fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: If the customer loses the plates in another country (Saudi Arabia), what is the procedure to replace them?

Answer 1:

  • In case of losing 1 plate, the customer can drive back to UAE and must present a police report.
  • In case of losing 2 plates, RTA forbids the customer from driving the vehicle back to UAE. The customer must present a police report.
fields.Process Time:
• Website: unidentified
  • Customer happiness centres or service providers: 10 minutes.
fields.Output: New plates.
fields.Service Fees:
• For each Short plate: 35 AED
  • For each Long plate: 50 AED
  • Luxury plate: 500 AED
  • +20 AED Knowledge and Innovation fees (in case the service fee is more than 50 AED) .
  • Sticker fee if the back plate is lost: 10 AED.

Note: When losing license plates, the customer should replace them with the new plate designs and pay again the stickers fees and the knowledge and innovation fees.

fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: When was the ownership e-card implemented for individuals?

Answer 1: Phase 1 on January 1, 2018: Government, rental and taxi vehicles.

Phase 2 on May 1, 2018: diplomatic and corporate vehicles.

Phase 3 on September 1, 2018: Individuals vehicles.

  • Question 2: What is ownership e-card and what details it includes?

Answer 2: The ownership e-card is an electronic document called "Vehicle License" sent to the customer via email. It includes all the ownership details including the expiry date, mortgage and insurance. This e-card is issued by the Road and Transport Authority and the customer has to print it or save it on their phone to show it to concerned authorities when needed.

  • Question 3: How can customers print the ownership e-card or any other document in case they didn’t receive an email or they wanted to verify the vehicle details, renewal date and insurance details?

Answer 3: The ownership e-card may be printed as follows:

    • Login to rta.ae.
    • Select Licensing services.
    • Scroll down the Certificate Verification service and press "Click Here".
    • Select service type "Vehicle License" then enter the vehicle details to show the print order.
  • Question 4: What details are featured on the vehicle license?

Answer 4: The vehicle license features all the details related to the vehicle including the expiry date, the mortgage and the insurance details. It is sent via email to the customer in a printable format.

  • Question 5: What happens when police patrols or officers request the ownership card?

Answer 5: The customer shows the ownership e-card featured in RTA applications and saved on his phone, or shows the printed copy of the e-card.

  • Question 6: How does the customer show the e-card to the licensing department?

Answer 6: The customer shows the ownership e-card featured in RTA applications and saved on his phone, or shows the printed copy of the e-card.

  • Question 7: How can the customer access the insurance details?

Answer 7: The insurance details are featured on the ownership e-card accessible through RTA mobile application, or on the printed copy of the vehicle license.

  • Question 8: How can the customer access the mortgage details?

Answer 8: Mortgage details are features on all the documents.

  • Question 9: What happens when the ownership details are amended?

Answer 9: In case any of the vehicle details get amended such as changing the plate number or the color:

-Details are updated on the ownership e-card and the vehicle’s license.

  • Question 10: What happens in case of loss or damage of the permanent ownership certificate?

Answer 10: A new copy is issued against the due fee.

  • Question 11: In case the customer doesn’t have RTA application, can the vehicle license be printed through the customer service centre?

Answer 11: There is no need for the customer service representative to print the vehicle license. The customer may print it through the link sent via email.

  • Question 12: Is the customer obliged to replace the vehicle license once the electronic ownership phase implemented?

Answer 12: The ownership certificate is replaced only upon its renewal, or in case of replacement of lost/damaged license or change in ownership document such as change of color or plate number or adding or redeeming a mortgage.

  • Question 13: In case the customer’s phone number was registered wrongly, how can the link be resent to him?

Answer 13: The customers shall update their personal details though RTA Call Centre: 8009090. Also he can print the ownership e-card as follows:

    • Login to rta.ae.
    • Select Licensing services
    • Scroll down the Certificate Verification service and press "Click Here"
    • Select service type "Vehicle License" then enter the vehicle details to show the print order.
  • Question 14: How can customers check the expiry date of their vehicle license?

Answer 14: The vehicle’s expiry date can be checked in several ways:

    • Through the details featured on the vehicle’s license.
    • Through the short messages sent to the customers’ mobile numbers.

fields.Description: This service enables you to reserve a parking according to the fees set by the law. The parking is reserved for special entities.

  2. Letter detailing the reason behind the request.

fields.Output: • Parking reservation permit.
fields.Service Fees:
• 9,000 AED for 1 parking over 1 year
  • 5,000 AED for 1 parking over 6 months
  • 2,800 AED for 1 parking over 3 months

  • 600 AED plate installation and parking plan fees
  • +20 AED Knowledge and Innovation fees.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• Coordinate with the Traffic Agency and the Right of Way Administration to make sure there are no negative effects on the traffic or the traffic safety.
  • Each building owner is entitled to a maximum of 2 parking spaces, and the assessment of the Parking Administration regarding the number of allocated spaces is considered final.
  • The owner must settle to the Parking Administration all fees related to equipping the reserved parking plus 25% administration fees.
  • The parking administration to coordinate with the Roads Maintenance Agency and its facilities to mark the reserved parking spaces in whichever way they see fit.
  • The permit is invalid for other already reserved parking spaces.
  • In case of applying through the website, the permit is not printed and the customer doesn't have to display it in the car.

• The customer can reserve 1 parking for each housing unit (villa or house) on condition that it is owned by a citizen and located in a region where parking spots are highly used.
  • The customer can reserve 1 parking for each housing unit (villa or house) owned by a citizen. The housing unit must be located in a region where parking fees are not applicable and where permits for public parkings (“resident” parking) are activated and allowed on condition that these parking spots are highly used or according to the assessment of the concerned department.
  • The customer must sign a form of permanent residence at the property approved by the concerned department.
  • The concerned department issues the cards to be used for the vehicles of the applicant during the reservation period. The department can locate and identify the reserved parkings in the way it finds appropriate or can inform the beneficiary about the means to do it.
  • The customer is required to settle the reservation fees and the yearly maintenance fees.
  • The card cannot be used for parkings reserved to other parties.
  • The customer must place the card in a recognisable spot on the front dashboard of the vehicle.

name: Apply for Seasonal Parking Cards for Public Parking

fields.Process:
Through online channels

  • The customer logs in to the website or mobile application using the username and password
  • The customer chooses the service of seasonal cards
  • The customer enters the vehicle’s details
  • The customer is required to settle the fees by credit card
  • The card is activated and there is no need for the customer to show it in case it was related to one vehicle. In case it was related to more than one vehicle (a maximum of 3), the customer has 2 choices:
    1. Print the seasonal parking card and place it in a recognizable spot on the dashboard of the vehicle using the public parking areas
    2. Use RTA smart app instead of the printed card to activate the vehicle using the public parking and benefit from the following features:
      • Avoid losing or damaging the card
      • There's no need to carry the parking permit and transfer it from one vehicle to another
      • Ability to remotely activate the vehicle using the parking space without the need to transfer the card from one vehicle to another.

Through kiosks

  • The customer logs in using the username and password
  • The customer chooses the service of seasonal cards
  • The customer enters the vehicle’s details
  • The customer is required to settle the fees by credit card
  • The card is activated instantly.

Through customer happiness centres

  • The customer submits the required documents
  • The customer is required to settle the fees
  • The customer can either print the card or use RTA smart app to activate it without the need to display it in the vehicle.

  • Customer happiness centres: 10 minutes depending on the centre's workload.
fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: Can the customer use the seasonal parking card for parkings located in the Development Areas (Tecom area, Dubai Silicon Oasis, etc.)?

Answer 1: No the customer cannot use the seasonal parking card for these parkings.
fields.Validity: The validity varies according to the subscription 3 months, 6 months or 1 year.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The customer is allowed to use the seasonal card labeled "General" only in public parkings Zone A,B,C and D, and the seasonal card labeled "Plots" only in public parkings Zone B and D
  • In case the card was related to one vehicle, there is no need for the customer to show it.
  • In case it was related to more than one vehicle a maximum of 3, the customer has 2 choices:
    1. Print the seasonal parking card and place it in a recognizable spot on the dashboard of the vehicle using the public parking areas
    2. Use RTA smart app instead of the printed card to activate the vehicle using the public parking the permit cannot be used for more than one vehicle at the same time and benefit from the following features:
      • Avoid losing or damaging the card
      • There's no need to carry the parking permit and transfer it from one vehicle to another
      • Ability to remotely activate the vehicle using the parking space without the need to transfer the card from one vehicle to another.
fields.Output: Seasonal parking cards.

Subscription card "General" that allows its holder to park in public parkings (Zone A, B, C and D)

Subscription card "Plots" that allows its holder to park in public parkings ( Zone B and D)

  • 700 AED for 3 months
  • 1,300 AED for 6 months
  • 2,400 AED for 1 year.

fields.Validity: The validity varies according to the event or campaign.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The customer must receive an approval from the Right of Way Department for traffic diversions and must coordinate with the Roads and Facilities Maintenance section for electrical connections.
  • Signs' installation must not conflict with traffic guidance signs or advertisement signs and must not block the visibility of drivers or affect the pedestrians path
  • Traffic guidance signs installation must not be on sidewalks, footpath and bicycle tracks
  • All advertising boards and flags must be installed not less than the height of the advertisement + 1m from road edge
  • The implementing company holds full responsibility over any damage that results from installing the advertisement. It is also responsible for maintaining and cleaning the boards
  • The customer is prohibited from installing any cutouts or additions or internal lights on the boards without having a permit. If the permit is approved, the lights must be well-fixed on the board
  • The customer must have an approval on the content of the advertisement from the Advertising Section of Dubai Municipality for all types of advertisements
  • The customer must abide by the adopted rules and conditions by the governmental departments and agencies, and must have the necessary approval of all concerned parties.
  • The customer receives a preliminary approval for 2 weeks to apply for a No Objection Certificate for permits that require NOCs. The permit is issued after receiving the NOC from the concerned service authorities.
  • The customer must have the approval of the Rail Agency for locations that are under its authority (near the route of the metro or the tram)
  • The customer must take all the measures and precautions related to public safety and preventive measures related to the safety of road users while installing, maintaining or removing advertising boards after obtaining the approval of the Right of Way Department for traffic diversions.
  • The customer must cooperate with the Advertisement and Investment Services section at the Traffic Department when installing the board to make sure that the installing company is using the location agreed on.
  • The customer must remove the advertisement when the permit expires and must leave the location clean as it used to be before.
  • The Roads and Transport Authority preserves its right to retract the permit or remove the boards or change their locations should they affect the traffic safety conditions or should they violate the licensing conditions or for any other reasons.
fields.Process:
Through website

  • The customer logs in using the username and password
  • The customer chooses the "Right of way advertising services"
  • The customer uploads the scanned required documents and receives a number for the transaction
  • The concerned parties at RTA check the request (technical study)
  • The customer receives the approval or the rejection of the request, through the website, email or SMS
  • In case of approval, the customer is required to settle the fees online through the advertising system or by cash through the service centres.
  • The customer prints the permit through the advertising system.

Note: For more information about the approval or the rejection of the request, the customer reviews the Advertising System through the application number.

name: Apply for the Exemption from Salik Fees

fields.Process:
Through email

  • The customer sends the commitment application form and the required documents to one of the following addresses: specialaccounts@salik.ae or customerservice@salik.ae

Through service centres

  • The customer submits the commitment application form and the required documents at the centre
  • After receiving the complete documents, the Special Accounts team verifies and process the request for exemption
  • Once the exemption is approved and updated in the system, customer is informed

Through call centre

  • The customer contacts Salik call centre on the following number: 80072545
  • The customer requests the exemption from Salik fees
  • The customer sends the required documents to one of the following addresses: specialaccounts@salik.ae or customerservice@salik.ae
  • The customer receives the exemption permit from the centre.
fields.FAQs: Follow this Link to check Salik related FAQs.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The validity of the exemption is 1 year and the customer must renew it on a yearly basis to avoid any violations
  • Only one vehicle can be exempted from paying Salik road toll fees for People of Determination, however the exemption can be transferred to another vehicle after the cancellation of the previous vehicle upon the customer's request
  • The relation of applicant (People of Determination) with the vehicle owner should be of the below mentioned category to apply for Salik fees exemption:
    • Category 1
      • Parents
      • Husband / Wife (Marriage Contract required )
      • Children (Birth Certificate required )
    • Category 2
      • Grandparents
      • Sister/ Brother
      • Grand children
  • Customer can download the commitment application form through Salik website, and can also receive it through email from customer service as per his request on 800-Salik (72545)
fields.Service Fees: • This service is free.
fields.Validity: 1 year from the date of issuing the exemption.
fields.Channels - Customer Happiness Centres:
• Customer Happiness Centre - Umm Ramool
  • Customer Happiness Centre - Al Towar
  • Customer Happiness Centre - Deira
fields.Output: Exemption for 1 year from Salik fees.
fields.Eligibility: Customers of determination (autistic patients, customers with visual, mental and physical disabilities) are eligible to apply for this service.
fields.Required Documents:
New Application

  1. Copy of Valid vehicle’s registration card of the People of Determination or one of the relative from 1st or 2nd degree
  2. Copy of Valid Emirates ID card (for applicant)
  3. Copy of Valid People of Determination ID card issued by Ministry of Community Development or Sanad card issued by Community Development Authority
  4. RTA commitment application form (if the applicant cannot drive)

Renewal

  1. Copy of Valid vehicle’s registration card of the People of Determination or one of the relative from 1st or 2nd degree
  2. Copy of Valid People of Determination ID card issued by Ministry of Community Development or Sanad card issued by Community Development Authority
  3. RTA commitment application form (if the applicant cannot drive)

Tag replacement/change of vehicle

  1. Copy of Valid vehicle’s registration card of the People of Determination or one of the relative from 1st or 2nd degree
  2. Copy of Valid Emirates ID card (for applicant)
  3. Copy of Valid People of Determination ID card issued by Ministry of Community Development or Sanad card issued by Community Development Authority
  4. RTA commitment application form (if the applicant cannot drive)
  5. Cancellation Form for the old exemption

name: Apply for Vehicle Online Selling Agreement

fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: What is electronic selling agreement?

Answer 1: An electronic selling agreement is a contract between two parties in the authorized showrooms. It is an alternative transaction for the traditional selling agreement.

  • Question 2: What will happen to the traditional selling agreement?

Answer 2: It will be cancelled and will not be accepted in centres.

Question 3: What are the characteristics of the electronic selling agreement?

Answer 3:

  • It guarantees the rights of the seller and the buyer
  • It protects the seller from transferring the ownership of vehicle or his plate without his knowledge since the transaction requires the presence of both parties when performing the transaction. It also requires checking the details of their emirates IDs through the card reader
  • The seller has no right to use the vehicle after performing the electronic selling agreement
  • It activates the role of using the Emirates ID as one of the most important documents in UAE
  • Keeping records of the vehicle or plate ownership transfer, especially when querying about the previous transactions for the vehicle or the plate
  • Finding records and statistics that were done in the showroom
  • Automatic cancellation of the selling agreement in case it was expired and the buyer did not complete the transaction
  • Registering the traffic fines (Dubai or other emirates' fines) under the buyer's name in case the selling agreement was still in his name from the day he signed it.
  • Question 4: Is there a smart card reader provided to showrooms?

Answer 4: Yes, showrooms will be provided with a smart card reader.

  • Question 5: Will the showrooms get trained on how to use the system?

Answer 5: Yes, RTA will hold a workshop after signing the agreement with the showrooms

  • Question 6: What is the scope of the electronic selling agreement?

Answer 6: It can be used in Dubai only.

  • Question 7: Can the transaction be done between individuals?

Answer 7: Yes, it can be done between individuals.

  • Question 8: Can the transaction be done between the showroom and individuals and the opposite?

Answer 8: Yes, it can be done between showrooms and individuals and the opposite.

  • Question 9: Can the transaction be done between the showroom and companies and the opposite?

Answer 9: Yes, it can be done between showrooms and companies and the opposite, only if the vehicle is owned by the showroom.
fields.Process:
Through service centres

  • The customer heads to the Procurement Department at RTA HQ , Bloc C
  • The customer presents the required documents
  • The customer prints the agreement from RTA website.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The Presence of the vehicle owner or his legal representative through a power of attorney stipulating the “sale and disposal of vehicles”.
  • The customer must perform any licensing transaction within 14 days to prevent any penalties and fines
  • The customer must register the fines that were made (Dubai and other Emirates fines).

Before receiving the service

  • The customer must settle all the fines
  • The customer must apply online and release the mortgage of the vehicle in case it is mortgaged.
fields.Output: Selling certificate.
fields.Service Fees: • 20 AED to be paid by the dealerships to the Roads and Transport Authority through e-wallet account or credit card.
fields.Channels - Service Centres: • Showrooms accredited by RTA
fields.Description: This service enables you to perform an online selling agreement in Dubai.
fields.Eligibility: All individual customers and pre-owned vehicle dealerships are eligible to apply for this service.
fields.Required Documents:
Individuals

  1. Original Emirates ID of both parties (buyer and seller)
  2. Gulf citizens visitors: Valid passport
  3. Arab visitors: Copy of the passport + valid visa
  4. Vehicle ownership in case of a registered vehicle, vehicle transfer certificate/export certificate/Customs Certificate.

Companies

  1. Original Emirates ID of both parties (buyer and seller)
  2. Vehicle ownership in case of a registered vehicle, vehicle transfer certificate/export certificate/Customs Certificate
  3. Copy of the trade license + list of partners
  4. Endorsement of signature from the notary public in the name of the dealership
  5. Copy of the memorandum of association for limited liability dealerships
  6. Vehicle insurance in the name of the company in case of registration.

name: Apply for Vehicle Renewal

fields.Process:
Through online channels

  • The customer enters the required information
  • The customer is required to settle the service fees by credit card
  • The customer receives the ownership certificate and the sticker through 1 of the following channels:
    • Through a courier company for a charge of 25 AED. The courier company makes 3 attempts to deliver the certificate before sending it back to the centre where the customer collects it
    • Through the Customer Happiness Centre in Deira or Al Barsha
    • Through kiosks by entering the details of the transaction. The customer receives the service from the printer of the kiosk.

Through kiosks

  • The customer chooses online services
  • The customer proceeds to the desired service and enters the vehicle's details
  • The customer receives the ownership certificate and the sticker from the printer of the kiosk.

Through customer happiness centres

  • The customer heads to the centre where he submits the required documents
  • The customer is required to settle the fees
  • The customer receives the ownership certificate and the sticker.

Through service providers

  • The customer heads to the service provider where he submits the required documents
  • The company inspects the vehicle
  • The customer is required to settle the service fees
  • The customer receives the ownership certificate and the sticker.

Through call centre

  • The customer contacts the call centre on the following number: 8009090
  • The customer requests the renewal of the vehicle ownership certificate
  • The customer is required to pay the fees by credit card
  • The customer receives the temporary ownership by email
  • The customer receives the certificate and the sticker through 1 of the following channels:
    • Through a courier company for a charge of 25 AED. The courier company makes 3 attempts to deliver the service before sending it back to the centre where the customer collects it
    • Through the Customer Happiness Centre in Deira or Al Barsha
    • Through kiosks by entering the details of the transaction. The customer receives the service from the printer of the kiosk.
fields.Process Time:
• Online channels: 3 working days
  • Kiosks: 5 minutes
  • Customer happiness centres and service providers: 5 minutes
  • Call centre: Instantly.
fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: In case of an expired vehicle ownership certificate, what are the fines that the customer is required to settle?

Answer 1: The customer is required to settle all vehicle pending fines in the case of an expired ownership and all Salik fines registered on his traffic file.

The customer is required to settle these fines only at the federal branches and at the Licensing Department in Deira and Al Barsha and at the Customer Happiness Centre- Umm Ramool.

  • Question 2: Is it required to periodically inspect vehicles of governmental and semi-governmental bodies and companies?

Answer 2: Yes, vehicles must undergo the technical test yearly.

  • Question 3: If the customer owns more than 1 vehicle, renewing the registration of which one is considered a priority?

Answer 3: If the customer owns 2 or more vehicles, he must always start by renewing the ownership or removing the ownership of vehicles listed on his traffic file with an expired registration.

  • Question 4: If the vehicle is registered in another emirate and the customer has a residence visa from the same emirate, is he allowed to renew the ownership in Dubai?

Answer 4: Yes, the service is only available for individuals and it can be only performed at Deira, Um Ramool, Al Aweer, Al Barsha and Al Manara Customer Happiness Centres.

  • Question 5: Can the customer renew the ownership in Dubai if he is from another emirate and the vehicle is registered in another emirate?

Answer 5: Yes, the customer must be an individual and must provide all the required documents to renew the ownership including the residence visa if he is not from Dubai. Any person can represent the customer to renew the ownership.

Example: If the vehicle is registered in Sharjah and the customer’s residence visa is issued in Abu Dhabi, the customer can renew the ownership at a vehicle registration centre in Dubai.

  • Question 6: Can the customer renew the ownership of a vehicle registered in Dubai in another emirate?

Answer 6: Yes, individual customers are eligible to renew the ownership of a vehicle registered in Dubai in another emirate.

  • Question 7: Can the customer renew the ownership of a vehicle registered outside Dubai if he has a residence visa from the mentioned emirate?

Answer 7: Yes, the customer can renew the ownership of a vehicle registered outside Dubai if he has a residence visa from the mentioned emirate.

  • Question 8: What is the validity of the technical test?

Answer 8: The technical test remains valid for 30 days from the date of its issuance.

  • Question 9: What is the procedure if the vehicle is new but the traffic system requests its inspection?

Answer 9: If the vehicle is brand new, bought with 0 miles and the customer is the first owner but the system requests its inspection, then the customer must check with the Customer Happiness Centre in Deira or Al Barsha.

  • Question 10: What is the validity of the tyres when renewing the ownership?

Answer 10: The validity of the tyres is 3 years if they are new (2012-2013-2014). If the tyres are damaged, the customer must change them to pass the inspection test.

Note: The customer must present a registration card to inspect the vehicle.

  • Question 11: Is the customer required to perform the inspection test if the vehicle is new and its ownership was not renewed for 6 months?

Answer 11: In case of registration of a brand new car bought from an accredited car agency, never preregistered, and with a valid custom certificate, it can be renewed on a yearly basis for the first 3 years without a technical test, provided that the renewal is done one day before the expiration of the registration. Any change of ownership will require technical inspection, even if done during the first 3 years.

  • Question 12: Is the customer required to update any information when applying for this service through the online channels?

Answer 12: When applying for this service through the online channels, the customer must update the insurance details on the traffic system (through the insurance company) and must update the details of the vehicle if necessary (through the inspection centre).

  • Question 13: When is the customer required to inspect the vehicles registered under the company’s traffic file?

Answer 13: Vehicles registered under the company’s traffic file must be inspected yearly after the registration. The company can renew the ownership certificate of the vehicle 149 days before its expiry.

  • Question 14: What are the steps that the customer must follow if the customer owns more than 1 vehicle and desires to renew ownership or cancel it after its expiry?

Answer 14: If the vehicle is new and the customer delays the renewal of its ownership for more than 6 months from the date of the first renewal, the vehicle must undergo a technical inspection test even if it is new before proceeding with the registration.

  • Question 15: Does RTA accept universal inspection tests to renew the ownership of a vehicle?

Answer 15: No, RTA does not accept these tests.

  • Question 16: What is a vehicle cancellation?

Answer 16: The cancellation of a vehicle is crossing it out from the traffic system either by issuing an ownership certificate or a transfer certificate or an export certificate.

To cancel the vehicle, the customer must present the original Emirates ID + copy of ID.

  • Question 17: What will happen if the customer did not renew the expired vehicle registration after 2 months?

Answer 17: The traffic file will be blocked after 3 months and the customer will receive a notification through sms.

  • Question 18: When was the ownership e-card implemented for individuals?

Answer 18:

    • Phase 1 on January 1, 2018: Government, rental and taxi vehicles
    • Phase 2 on May 1, 2018: diplomatic and corporate vehicles
    • Phase 3 on September 1, 2018: Individuals vehicles.
  • Question 19: What is ownership e-card and what details it includes?

Answer 19: The ownership e-card is an electronic document called (Vehicle License) sent to the customer via email. It includes all the ownership details including the expiry date, mortgage and insurance. This e-card is issued by the Road and Transport Authority and the customer has to print it or save it on their phone to show it to concerned authorities when needed.

  • Question 20: How can customers print the ownership e-card or any other document in case they didn’t receive an email or they wanted to verify the vehicle details, renewal date and insurance details?

Answer 20: The ownership e-card may be printed as follows:

    • Login to rta.ae
    • Select Licensing services
    • Scroll down the Certificate Verification service and press Click Here
    • Select service type (Vehicle License) then enter the vehicle details to show the print order.
  • Question 21: What details are featured on the vehicle license?

Answer 21: The vehicle license features all the details related to the vehicle including the expiry date, the mortgage and the insurance details. It is sent via email to the customer in a printable format.

  • Question 22: What happens when police patrols or officers request the ownership card?

Answer 22: The customer shows the ownership e-card featured in RTA applications and saved on his phone, or shows the printed copy of the e-card.

  • Question 23: How does the customer show the e-card to the licensing department?

Answer 23: The customer shows the ownership e-card featured in RTA applications and saved on his phone, or shows the printed copy of the e-card.

  • Question 24: What is required when crossing the borders?

Answer 24:

For UAE and GCC countries:

    • Vehicle license.

If the costumer is not from GCC countries: Vehicle license, tourist certificate, and trip ticket

For other countries:

    • Vehicle license, tourist certificate, and trip ticket.
  • Question 25: How can the customer access the insurance details?

Answer 25: The insurance details are featured on the ownership e-card accessible through RTA mobile application, or on the printed copy of the vehicle license.

  • Question 26: How can the customer access the mortgage details?

Answer 26: Mortgage details are features on all the documents including the permanent ownership.

  • Question 27: What happens when the ownership details are amended?

Answer 27: In case any of the vehicle details get amended such as changing the plate number or the color:

- Details are updated on the ownership e-card and the vehicle’s license.

  • Question 28: When the individual phase is implemented and in case the customer doesn’t have RTA application, can the vehicle license be printed through the customer service centre?

Answer 28: There is no need for the customer service representative to print the vehicle license. The customer may print it through the link sent via email.

  • Question 29: Is the customer obliged to replace the vehicle license once the electronic ownership phase implemented?

Answer 29: The ownership certificate is replaced only upon its renewal, or in case of replacement of lost/damaged license or change in ownership document such as change of color or plate number or adding or redeeming a mortgage.

  • Question 30: In case the customer’s phone number was registered wrongly, how can the link be resent to him?

Answer 30: The customers shall update their personal details though RTA Call Centre: 8009090. Also he can print the ownership e-card as follows:

    • Login to rta.ae
    • Select Licensing services
    • Scroll down the Certificate Verification service and press Click Here
    • Select service type (Vehicle License) then enter the vehicle details to show the print order.
  • Question 31: How can customers check the expiry date of their vehicle license?

Answer 31: The vehicle’s expiry date can be checked in several ways:

  • Through the details featured on the vehicle’s license
  • Through the short messages sent to the customers’ mobile numbers.
fields.Meta Title: Renewing Vehicle Ownership/ Car Registration - RTA Dubai
fields.Meta Description: Get complete information and renew your car registration via simple and easy steps, instantly through our online Channels and Call Centre.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• In the event of delay in renewing the license of a vehicle, the customer is required to pay a fine for each month as follows:
    • 25 AED light vehicle
    • 12 AED motorcycle
    • 50 AED heavy vehicles and buses
  • The insurance is optional when renewing the ownership of a quad bike or a trailer and semi-trailer
  • To renew the ownership of a vehicle that is outside Dubai, the customer must present an inspection certificate ratified by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the concerned country and also by the UAE embassy. The UAE Ministry of Foreign Affairs must also ratify it. The customer presents it at the technical inspection centres within a period of 1 month. GCC countries citizens are exempted from ratifying the documents
  • Commercial companies and owners of fleets and facilities must not have any impediments or circulars on the vehicle file or the file of the company that owns the vehicle.
  • The customer can renew the ownership of a vehicle 150 days before its expiry
  • The customer is required to settle all the traffic fines before receiving this service.
  • Companies can only apply for this service through online channels (same condition will apply to individuals whose vehicles do not need a technical examination during the first 3 years of registration)
  • The commercial vehicles that were purchased from a local dealer after the approval of the Ministry of Economy are exempted from the technical inspection for the first year starting from the date of registration
  • The inspection of the classical vehicles must be undertaken at:
    • Barsha Tasjeel
    • Al Warsan Tasjeel
    • Wasel Nad Al Hammar
    • Wassel Al Jaddaf.
    • Tamam Vehicle Testing
    • AG Cars Vehicle Testing - Al Mamzar
    • Al Mutakamela Vehicles Testing

fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: Which franchise companies are in charge of this service?

Answer 1: The Service provider is Via Transportation (with local partner – United Trans)

  • Question 2: Can someone travel from one zone to another zone?

Answer 2: No, currently the services are limited to the five zones (geo-fenced services). Travel from one zone to another zone is not permitted.

  • Question 3: Can a customer book multiple seats?

Answer 3: Yes, group booking is allowed.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• Based on the terms and conditions of the smart application while registering for the service.
  • Initially 5 zones are covered (Al Barsha 1, Dubai Internet City, International City, Dubai Silicon Oasis and the Greens) with total of 13 vehicles. New vehicles shall be added as the demand grows.
fields.Process:
Through the smart application

  • The customer downloads the smart application.
  • The customer registers for the service.
  • The customer activates the application after confirming the provided data /payment details.
  • The app specifies the location of the vehicle, seat availability, time required for arrival of the bus, estimated travel time to the desired destination within the zone of operation.
  • The customer books the service either with inApp payment or through Nol Card (POS machine are installed in the bus with NI integration with RTA’s existing payment gateway).
  • The customer takes the ride and reaches his pre-designated destination.
fields.Output: Travel during times or to locations where existing fixed-route options are limited.
fields.Service Fees: • Flat fee of maximum AED 5 per trip/passenger.
fields.Eligibility: Tourists and residents are eligible to use the service.
fields.Required Documents: 1. Valid credit card or nol Card.
fields.Description:
This service enables you to connect to the first and last mile, by booking a bus seat or more to travel in Dubai with affordable prices, during times or to locations where existing fixed-route options are limited.

Once operational full fledged this service will compliment the public transport system of Dubai and help achieving an ambitious target for Public Transport.

name: Information About Public Transport and Journey Planning

fields.Description:
This journey planner is a system that helps you choose the best means to commute by providing accurate and real-time information about the nearest available transportation means according to your point of departure, destination and time of the journey.

The service also enables you to view the timetable of buses, metros and the water buses, and to print these timetables and the routes after providing the necessary information related to the date and time. The system provides the available journey options and the relevant fares for buses or metros or water buses. It also provides you with the suitable alternatives.

The service also provides you with the real-time of the buses’ arrival as well as the major touristic landmarks in Dubai and locations of the Roads and Transport Authority (RTA) service centres as well as the names of all streets and major areas in Dubai and other emirates.
fields.Terms and Conditions: • The service is available 24/7 from anywhere in the world.
fields.Process:
Through website

  • The customer enters to the website
  • The customer enters the required details.

Through mobile application

  • The customer downloads the application
  • The customer enters the required details.
fields.Service Fees: This service is free.
fields.Output: Checking the right choice for the journey.
fields.Required Documents: This service has no required documents.
fields.Eligibility: All individual customers are eligible to benefit from this service.

name: Installing Safety Equipment for Heavy Vehicles

fields.Description: This service enables all Dubai registered heavy vehicles to be equipped with telematics devices allowing the Roads and Transport Authority (RTA) and fleet operators to detect faults in the vehicles and monitor the driver's behaviour.
fields.Eligibility:
All commercial heavy vehicles that are registered in the Emirate of Dubai are eligible to apply for this service.

The below vehicles are excluded from this service:

  • Heavy vehicles belonging to governmental entities (Civil Defence, Ambulance Services, Dubai Police)
  • Vehicles registered under Dubai Police Secure Path Programme and Dubai Municipality RASID Programme
  • Trailers
  • Light vehicles
  • Commercial vehicles owned by individuals
  • Motorcycles
  • Buses (heavy, light)
  • Mechanical equipment (heavy, light)
  • Vehicles from other Emirates
  • Internationally registered vehicles.
fields.Required Documents:
1. Valid company trade license issued by DED or any Dubai free-zone authority
  2. Valid vehicle registration issued by RTA
  3. Valid driver practice permit issued by RTA.
fields.Average Waiting Time:
• The expected average waiting time for registration process is 15 minutes
  • For device installation the maximum expected average installation time is 60 minutes per vehicle
fields.Output:
• Device with card reader and first time installation and activation
  • One year of communication, system access and support
  • Issuance and activation of driver identification tag ID
  • Roaming service for one Telematics device (Optional).
fields.Service Fees:
• 1,000 AED/ Device with card reader and first time installation and activation
  • 500 AED/year for communication, system access and support
  • 120 AED/driver for the issuance and activation of the driver's identification tag ID
  • 600 AED/year for adding the roaming service per Telematics device (optional)
  • +20 AED / transaction, Knowledge and Innovation Fees

Note: Additional fees will be charged in case the telematics device, the driver identification tag ID and/or the reader is lost or damaged.
fields.Validity: The service validity is for one year from the date of payment
fields.Terms and Conditions:
Mandatory Subscription:

  • Any Dubai registered , commercial, non-Government, heavy vehicle
  • All ages of vehicle fleet starting with vehicles greater than 15 years starting 01st September, 2018

Other Terms and Conditions:

  • Vehicles with existing telematics devices (other than VSS device) that are eligible for this service will be required to install the VSS device
  • The telematics device, driver identification tag id and reader come with a 5 year manufacturer warranty
  • Should the telematics device, driver identification tag id and reader be lost or damaged, additional replacement charges apply
fields.Process:
• Companies (Fleet Operators) must settle the fees of the VSS Service as part of the vehicle renewal process
  • For the first installation, the company registers through the VSS Call Centre (600560005) or RTA portal (logged in admin users)
  • For registered company, the company receives an alert notification from the Telematics Operator, requesting for the company the driver details and the schedule of an appointment
  • After completing the registration, the company receives access to the Telematics Operator system. The company can identify the vehicles for installation, provide associated driver details and select an appointment time slot for installation as per availability
  • Companies can request for an installation in their premises if they have a dedicated space on site
  • The company receives a reminder 48 hours prior to the appointment. It has to make the vehicle available for installation at the requested date, time and location. Upon installation, the company will be able to monitor the vehicle in the Telematics Operator system and get access to different reports and services.
fields.Process Time:
• Company registration: Less than 5 minutes
  • Installation and activation of device with card reader: 25 to 60 minutes (depending on vehicle, model and mechanical condition)
  • System access and activation: Upon completion of installation.

This service also enables you to reset and change your password by contacting the Call Centre or through RTA website.

name: Manage the e-Wallet Account

fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: How many days of transaction history is shown?

Answer 1: 30 days.
fields.Process:
If the customer doesn’t have an e-Wallet account

  • The customer logs in to RTA website.
  • The customer selects individuals/companies
  • The customer creates an account for individuals/companies if he didn't have an account.
  • The customer fills in the requested data and creates the account.
  • The customer logs in to RTA website.
  • The customer clicks on the e-Wallet icon.
  • The customer clicks on Create e-Wallet Account.
  • The "Creates an e-Wallet account" pre-filled form appears.
  • The customer confirms the information and agrees to the Terms and Conditions, then clicks "Create Account".
  • The customer receives the e-Wallet number and the Pin code by e-mail.
  • The customer logs in to his RTA account
  • The customer clicks on the e-Wallet icon
  • The customer clicks on "Link e-Wallet Account"
  • The customer fills the e-Wallet account details and clicks on "Link"
  • The customer is redirected to "Manage e-Wallet Account".

To Reset PIN code

  • The customer logs in to RTA website.
  • The customer clicks on "Reset Pin" code.
  • The customer clicks on "Reset Pin" and "Confirm".

To Update PIN code

  • The customer logs in to RTA website.
  • The customer clicks on "Update Pin" code.
  • The customer enters the old Pin code.
  • The customer adds the new Pin code and clicks on "confirm".

To Update Trade License

  • The customer logs in to RTA website.
  • The customer clicks on "Update Trade License".
  • The customer confirms the Trade License information and attach a copy of the updated Trade License.
  • The customer clicks on "confirm".

To Update Account Information

  • The customer logs in to RTA website.
  • The customer clicks on "Update Account Information".
  • The customer updates the required information.
  • The customer clicks on "confirm".

To Update the Password

  • The customer logs in to RTA website.
  • The customer clicks on "Update Password".
  • The customer enters the old and new password.
  • The customer clicks on "confirm".
fields.Service Fees: • This service is free.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The customer must have an account on RTA website linked to his e-Wallet account.
  • To Reset the e-Wallet PIN the customer should have a valid trade license.
fields.Output:
• View Transaction History
  • Reset PIN
  • Update PIN
  • Update Trade License
  • Service Subscription
  • Update Account Information.
fields.Eligibility: Individuals and companies are eligible to apply for this service.
fields.Required Documents:

name: Pay Public Parking Fees

fields.Validity: The validity varies according to the parking duration.
fields.Terms and Conditions: • The customer can check the conditions of settling parking fees through mParking on the website of RTA.
fields.Process:
Through mobile application

  • The customer downloads the mobile application
  • The customer enters the required details to create an account
  • The customer receives an email to validate the registration
  • The customer can settle parking fees by topping up the parking account with a maximum balance of 500 AED.

Through SMS

For customers who are not registered for the service (only vehicles registered in Dubai)

  • The customer sends an SMS to 7275 according to the following format: vehicle’s plate number and code <space<area code<space<duration in hour.
  • For example: A 00000 in area 000 A for 2 hours ِA00000 000A 2 in English. The customer starts the SMS with letter A and a space. For example: A 00000 000A.
  • Note: The area code is written on the directive signboards of parkings.
  • The customer receives a confirmation SMS that includes the details of the purchased e-ticket
  • The customer receives another SMS 15 minutes before the end of the parking time
  • If the customer desires to extend the parking time, he must send an SMS with the letter Y or ن to 7275.

For registered customers ( for vehicles registered elsewhere and private vehicles registered in Dubai)

  • The customer sends an SMS to 7275 in the following format: customer’s username<space<area code<duration in hour. For example: Ali1 000A 2 (for using the parking for 2 hours) or Ali1 000A (for using the parking for 1 hour)
  • The customer receives a confirmation SMS that includes the details of the purchased e-ticket
  • The customer receives another SMS 15 minutes before the end of the parking time
  • If the customer desires to extend the parking time, he must send an SMS with the letter Y or ن to 7275.

Through parking machines

Using coins

  • The customer inserts coins for the desired time and desired parking (one dirham and half dirham coins are accepted)
  • The customer places the ticket received from the machine in a recognisable spot on the front dashboard of the vehicle if the paper ticket is printed
  • If the ticket was purchased from the parking machines, a payment receipt will be issued stating the required information
  • A non-printed electronic ticket will be issued without the need to place it inside the vehicle

Using nol card

  • The customer uses the nol card in the machines deployed around parking lots to settle the fees for the desired time and desired parking
  • The machine deducts the value from the balance of the card
  • The customer places the ticket received from the machine in a recognisable spot on the front dashboard of the vehicle if the paper ticket is printed
  • If the ticket was purchased from the parking machines, a payment receipt will be issued stating the required information
  • A non-printed electronic ticket will be issued without the need to place it inside the vehicle
fields.Output: E-ticket or paper ticket to use the parking according to the paid period.
