name: Purchase an Anonymous nol Card

fields.FAQs:
Silver nol card

  • Question 1: What are the features of nol Silver Card?

Answer 1: nol Silver Card is a smart card with an e-purse that can be loaded with up to AED 1000 for non-registered users and AED 5000 after registration in the system. The card can be purchased instantly from any ticket office or a number of ticket vending machines for only AED 25 including AED 19 e-Wallet balance.

  • Question 2: Where can I top-up a Silver Card?

Answer 2: The Silver nol Card can be topped-up at ticket offices, ticketing vending machines, authorized sales agents and through Public Transport mobile application using the NFC feature.

Gold nol card

  • Question 1: What is a nol Gold Card, and what is the difference between it and other nol Cards?

Answer 1: nol Gold Card is an anonymous card with the same features as the Silver Card, but it gives you the privileged access to Metro’s Gold Class seats for premium charges.

  • Question 2: Can I use the nol Gold Card on all transport Means?

Answer 2: Yes. The Gold Card can be used on all public transport means. It can also be used to pay for RTA paid parking at a parking machine, in addition to the previously mentioned features.

  • Question 3: Will I pay Gold Class premium fares even if there were no available seats in the Gold Class Metro cars?

Answer 3: Yes, if you use your Gold Card on Metro or Tram, you will always be charged the Gold Class premium fare, even if there were no seats available in the designated Gold Class car. But if you use it on Bus or any other transport means like taxis, that don't offer a Gold Class service, you will be charged the regular fare.

  • Question 4: How can I purchase a nol Gold Card and what is the cost?

Answer 4: You can purchase the card from Metro ticket offices.

nol Gold Card Price is AED 25 including AED 19 e-wallet value.
fields.Process:
Through ticket vending offices at metro and tram stations, ticket vending machines and authorised sales agents

  • The customer heads to the purchasing channel.
  • The customer settles the fees in cash.
  • The customer receives the card.
fields.Validity:
• Silver/Gold nol card: 5 years. Plus 2 years after the expiry, without eligibility to top up the card e-Wallet
  • nol red tickets: 90 days or 10 travels
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The journey fare is calculated automatically and deducted from the customer’s e-wallet.
  • The card is valid in all means of public transport and non-transportation services.
  • Golden card holders can use the first class cabin in trams and metros.
fields.Service Fees:
• Anonymous nol card: 25 AED (with 19 AED as card balance).
  • nol Red Ticket: 2 AED.
fields.Channels - Service Centres:
• Ticket vending offices at metro and tram stations
  • Ticket vending machines
fields.Output: Gold and Silver nol card and nol red ticket.
fields.Required Documents: • This service has no required documents.

name: Recharge a Salik Account Online

fields.FAQs: Follow this Link to check Salik related FAQs.
fields.Process:
Recharging through ePay

Through ePay website

  • The customer logs in using the username and password
  • The customer clicks on the recharging tab
  • The customer enters the required payment details
  • Once the recharge is done, the Salik balance will be updated.

Through mobile application

  • The customer downloads the Smart Salik Application
  • The customer logs in using the username and the PIN code
  • The customer chooses the recharge option from the list of content
  • The customer chooses ePay
  • The customer enters the required details
  • The customer chooses the desired balance
  • The customer clicks on “next”
  • The following message appears on the screen: “Your Salik account number “a1” was recharged electronically. Your new balance is “a3” AED. Thank you.”

Recharging through mPay (an electronic channel that allows the customer to recharge the Salik account balance using the registered mobile number)

  • The customer logs in using the email and password
  • The customer clicks on the recharge tab
  • The customer enters the required payment details
  • Once the recharge is done, the Salik balance will be updated.

Recharging through Kiosks

  • The customer logs in using the email and password
  • The customer clicks on the recharge tab
  • The customer pays the amount cash
  • Once the recharge is done, the Salik balance will be updated.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• To use the mPay service, the customer must log in to the mPay website and create an account for this service
  • To use the ePay service, the customer must have an e-account on Salik website or mobile application.
fields.Service Fees: Value of the added balance (no extra fees).
fields.Output: Recharging Salik account.

• Customer Happiness Centre - Umm Ramool
  • Customer Happiness Centre - Deira
  • Customer Happiness Centre - Al Barsha
  • Customer Happiness Centre - Al Towar
  • Customer Happiness Centre - Al Aweer
  • Customer Happiness Centre - Al Kifaf

fields.FAQs: Follow this Link to check Salik related FAQs.
fields.Output: Recharging Salik account.
fields.Service Fees:
• Value of the added balance
  • In case of recharging through SMS, 30 fils will be deducted to the account of the customer's mobile operator.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The customer can recharge his account through banks, however he will need to confirm with his respective bank if the service is provided. Click here to check the banks list
  • The minimum recharge amount per transaction is 50 AED and the maximum is 50,000 AED.

Note: Recharge amount should be in a multiple of 50. For ex: 50, 100, 150...
fields.Process:
Through website

Recharging account (without logging in)

  • The customer enters the mobile number, the plate number and the recharge number
  • Once the recharge is done, the balance in the Salik account will be updated.

Recharging account (after logging in)

  • The customer enters the username and password
  • Customer clicks on recharge tab and chooses the method
  • The customer enters the recharge number
  • Once the recharge is done, the balance of the Salik account will be updated
  • The customer can also recharge another account by identifying the other account using the account number and PIN code or the mobile number and plate details
  • The customer enters the recharge number
  • Once the recharge is done, the balance in the Salik account will be updated.

Through mobile application

Recharging account (without logging in)

  • The customer must set up an initial profile either by entering the account number and the PIN code or the mobile number and the plate details of the account to be recharged
  • Once the profile is set up, the customer can recharge the account by entering the recharge number.

Note: The personal profile details will be saved for future recharges.

Recharging account (after logging in)

  • The customer enters the username and password
  • The customer enters the recharge number
  • If the customer desires to recharge another account, he must enter the personal profile details and the recharge number.

Through kiosks

  • The customer enters the account number, the pin number and the recharge amount.

Through SMS:

  • The customer sends the account number, the PIN code and the recharge number via sms to the following number: 5959.

The SMS format i.e. R*12 digits salik recharge card number*Salik account number*Pin number

Example: R*345678912345*1234567890*1234

Through Salik self service on Salik call centre

Recharging account (without logging in)

  • The customer enters the (account number and the PIN code) or the (mobile number and plate number) or (tag number and plate number)
  • The customer enters the recharge number.

Recharging account (after logging in)

  • The customer logs in to the account using the account number and the PIN code
  • The customer chooses the recharging service (own account or friend's account)
  • The customer enters the recharge number.

1. Salik account number and PIN code
  2. Vehicle plate number + mobile number registered with Salik
  3. Vehicle plate number + Salik tag number (Salik Self Service on Salik Call Centre).

name: Refund nol Cards Balance

fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: Can the customer refund the remaining balance in case of a lost card?

Answer 1: : In case of a lost or stolen card, the customer should apply for a refund online. His card will be blacklisted within 48 hours, and the remaining e-Wallet balance will be refunded.
fields.Process:
If the customer doesn’t want to use the card while it is still valid

  • The customer submits the card at the ticket office.
  • The customer requests refund of the remaining e-Wallet.
  • Refund fees will be deducted (5 AED or 2.5% of the remaining balance).
  • The customer receives the remaining balance in cash.

Damaged Card

  • The customer applies for the Refund in any of RTA’s authorized channels.
  • The customer collects the refund depending on his preferred option (Cash or Transfer).
  • The customer with the Damaged nol card applies for a new personalized card online or purchase a new anonymous card through available channels.

Lost Card

  • The customer applies for the Refund request in any of RTA’s authorized channel.
  • nol card is blacklisted by default when refund is created .
  • If the customer reported the card lost before applying for the refund, he is no longer able to apply for refund, as the card is automatically blocked.
  • The customer receives the refund amount as cash or transfer after 8 days.
fields.Channels - Service Centres: • Smart Teller Machines (In all RTA Happiness Centres)
fields.Output: Refund the remaining balance of the card if conditions were met.
fields.Service Fees:
• Cash Refund Collection: 2.5% or AED 5 on the total card balance are deducted.
  • Transaction: Refund amount is transferred to the new/alternative nol card with no service fees.
fields.Validity:
• Cash refund: 60 days from the date of approval.
  • Transaction refund: 180 days from the date of approval.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The customer can provide the number of an alternative nol card to transfer the refunded amount to.
  • The customer can refund the card balance even if it was lost (Tag ID must be provided).
  • Service Fees apply depending on the refund option (Cash refund /Transaction refund).
  • Defective cards must be validated in any of the authorized stations to be assessed by the station agents whether it was a Faulty or a Damaged card.
    • Faulty cards: The customer is given a replacement card of the same type without any cost. However, the customer has to pay AED 19 for the e-Wallet balance on the new card.
    • Damaged card: The customer receives a new card of the same type and pays AED 25 for the new card + AED 30 for card registration (optional).
  • Cash refund can be collected after receiving the approval notice (SMS) at the Smart Teller Machine located at any RTA Customer Happiness Center or in any of the authorized stations listed in the SMS.
  • The customer must read the terms and conditions on the refund request.
  • Refunding the price of the card is not possible.
  • The customer can select the refund option as cash or transfer to another nol card. If the refund option was cash then there is a service fee of 2.5% of e-Wallet balance or 5 AED whichever is higher.
  • Combi nol card holders should apply for refund in the Bank.
fields.Required Documents:
1. nol card Tag ID
  2. nol alternative card (in case of transfer refund)
  3. Valid mobile number
fields.Eligibility: nol card holders with remaining e-Wallet balance or valid Travel Pass.
fields.Description: This service enables to apply to refund nol card and receive the remaining value of the e-Wallet and unused travel pass balance.

fields.Terms and Conditions:
Renewing travel Pass

  • The customer can renew the travel pass 5 days before its expiry and it will be activated when the existing pass expires.
  • The customer can renew it in any metro station or online portal
  • The customer can only renew with the same product type and period.

Travel Pass Refund

  • The customer can get a refund of the remaining days from the Travel Pass provided that the card is faulty, damaged or lost. Remaining days from the product is calculated after the refund request is submitted.

Note: Cash refund service charge is applied

Question 1: What’s the benefit of this service?

fields.Process:
For Per Seat type

For Per Bus type

  • The Contract is signed with the School directly. The parents are contacted by the school to enrol for the transportation.

1. Emirates ID or passport copy for the parent and the student

• Free of charge on all RTA Channels

fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The maximum top up amount is 1,000 AED for the unidentified blue cards and 5,000 AED for registered cards.
  • The minimum card balance is 7.5 AED.
  • Topping up nol card is instant if the customer was using the "smart fare" option through the mobile application.
fields.Process:
Through website or mobile application

  • Customer enters the tag id of his nol card (for guest users) or select the tag ID from the drop down menu (for logged in users).
  • The customer is required to settle the top-up fees by credit card or debit card.
  • The customer waits 45 minutes to 4 hours.
  • To activate the online top up, the customer should use the card at any entrance gate at the metro station or can insert the card at any online parking machine for a few seconds and then remove it.

Through Solar-Powered nol Top Up Machine

  • Customer should place the card on the card reader to be updated.


Through TOM offices and banks

  • The customer presents the card.
  • The customer is required to settle the top-up fees and the service fees, if any, by credit card or in cash.
  • The balance is topped up instantly.
fields.Process Time:
• In order to activate the top up pending e-Wallet balance, the card holder must tap/insert his nol card on one of the below machines:

    Kiosks and smart teller and ticket vending offices: 3 minutes
    Metro Gates: 48 Hours
    Solar Machines: 20 minutes
    Parking meters: 45 minutes
fields.Channels - Service Centres:
• Ticket vending offices and machines available at all metro and bus stations.
  • Ticket Vending Machine available at all metro and bus stations.
  • Bus Solar-Powered machine located on selected Bus stops.
  • Smart Teller Device (located on all RTA Customer Happiness Centre).
fields.Required Documents: 1. nol card (Silver, Gold, personalized Blue card)

name: Top Up the e-Wallet Account

fields.Description: This service enables you to top up your e-wallet by credit card through RTA website or by Cash through Al Ansari Exchange or through Mobile Application (companies only).
fields.Eligibility: Individuals and companies are eligible to apply for this service.
fields.Required Documents: • This service has no required documents.
fields.Channels - Service Centres: • Al Ansari Exchange.
fields.Output: Topping up the e-wallet balance.
fields.Service Fees:
• 60 AED to add more than 50,000 AED
  • 20 AED to add 50,000 AED or less
  • 15 AED to add 20,000 AED or less
  • Free of charge if the customer is topping up the balance through the online channels.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The customer must maintain the confidentiality of the information.
  • Only the authorized person can top-up the e-Wallet.
fields.Process:
Through Online Channels

  • The customer Logs in to e-Wallet Account.
  • The customer Clicks on Top up e-Wallet Account.
  • The customer Chooses the amount and clicks on pay.
  • The customer is redirected to DSG payment gateway.
  • The Customer enters his credit card details and confirms the payment.
  • The Customer’s e-Wallet account is topped up.

Through Al Ansari Exchange

  • The customer provides the e-Wallet account number to the agent.
  • The Customer chooses to pay by cash or Credit card or Cheque.
  • The customer’s e-Wallet account is topped up.
fields.FAQs:

Answer 1:

  • The maximum top up amount is AED 500,000.

Answer 2:

  • The minimum top up amount is AED 10
  • The maximum top up amount is AED 50,000.

Transport Using Abra (Scheduled Trips)

fields.Description:
This service enables you to commute using Dubai Abra. There are 3 types of Abras in Dubai:

  1. Petrol Heritage Abra: It is a new Abra with a traditional design. This Abra has a petrol engine and can accommodate 20 passengers including passengers of determination. The Abra is equipped with the highest safety and security standards and provides the needed means for the comfort of the passengers so they enjoy the traditional Abra with a modern touch.
  2. Electrical Abra: It is an environment friendly Abra that can accommodate 9 passengers.
  3. Air-conditioned Abra: This Abra which can accommodate 20 passengers is known for providing the best ambiance throughout the year especially during the summer season. The marine station in Al Jaddaf is the first station that has a special building to provide this service from Dubai Station to Dubai Festival City.
fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: What is the procedure if the customer loses his belongings in the marine means of transport?

Answer 1: For lost and found items, the customer must head to the Ghubaiba office within 24 hours. After that period, the office will give the found items to the police department (Emirates IDS or passport). In case of regular belongings, they will be kept at the office until the customer takes them.

  • Question 2: What is the procedure for POD Passengers?

Answer 2: 1 POD passenger can be accommodated per trip in Heritage/AC Abra per trip free of charge. They have to present the valid People of Determination card to the customer service agent before boarding the vessel. (Only valid on Commuter Trips).
fields.Process Time:
• To purchase the ticket: instantly
  • The customer receives the service on the time of the scheduled trip.
fields.Output: Transport using Abra.
fields.Service Fees:
• Petrol Heritage Abra: AED 2/trip
  • Air-conditioned Abra: AED 2/trip
  • Electrical Abra: AED 2/trip
fields.Validity: The validity varies according to the trip type.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• The customer must comply with the terms and conditions listed on the ticket
  • The customer must be at the station before the trip time
  • The route of the Abra is subject to change or cancellation due to weather conditions or for safety and security reasons.
fields.Process:
Through Abra stations

Air-conditioned and electrical Abra

  • The customer purchases BOS Viva tickets from Marine Station

Petrol Heritage Abra:

  • The customer tops up the nol card if available or purchases a nol card from the station to use the service
  • The customer taps the card on the nol machine upon entering and leaving the Abra.

Note: The customer can purchase BOS Viva tickets from Dubai creek customer service centres to use the heritage petrol Abra.
fields.Average Waiting Time:
• Petrol Heritage Abra: 20 minutes (scheduled trip)
  • Electrical Abra: instantly
  • Air-conditioned Abra: 20 minutes (scheduled trip).

fields.Meta Description: Plan your journey to travel to other emirates via Dubai bus inter-city service. Find more about intercity Bus numbers, schedules routes.
fields.Meta Title: Travel from Dubai to Other Emirates | Using Intercity Buses from RTA
fields.Output: Transport using buses from and to Dubai.
fields.Service Fees: • The fees vary according to the destination.
fields.Terms and Conditions: • The customer must comply with the general rules and regulations.
fields.Process:
Through stations

  • The customer purchases the paper ticket
  • The customer checks the scheduled trips on the website
  • The customer arrives to the station before the trip time
  • The customer taps the ticket on the machine upon entering and leaving the bus.
fields.Process Time: • The process time varies according to the departure and arrival of the buses.
fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: How can I check the schedule of the trips?

Answer 1: You can check the schedule by visiting Wojhati website to know the departure time of the last bus. The schedules vary according to departure and arrival times.

  • Question 2: What is the procedure if the customer loses his belongings in the bus or finds someone else belongings?

Answer 2: For lost and found items, the customer must provide the details of the item as well as the details of the trip and a contact number when presenting a request to RTA’s call centre. In case of finding someone else belongings, the customer must give them to the customer service centre or to the driver.
fields.Channels - Service Centres:
• Ticket vending offices at bus stations

Note: The buses work according to shifts at stations and the customer can check trip times by visiting RTA website or by calling S'hail call centre on the following number: 600500605.
fields.Eligibility: All individual customers are eligible to benefit from this service.
fields.Required Documents: 1. nol card or paper ticket (the customer must check with the ticket vending office)
fields.Description: This service enables you to use buses of different models and capacities provided by the Roads and Transport Authority (RTA) to commute inside the emirates according to the routes of the buses and the agreements concluded between RTA and other operating parties. The service aims at linking Dubai from various internal points to other emirates and cities and vice versa.

Answer 2: For lost and found items, the customer must provide the details of the item as well as the details of the trip and a contact number when presenting a request to RTA’s call centre. In case of finding someone else belongings, the customer must give them to the customer service centre or to the driver.

fields.Terms and Conditions:
• In order to ensure that Dubai Tram is used safely and securely, the violations and fines schedule is applied. Inspectors patrol in tram stations and cabins to make sure customers are properly using the provided service.
  • Tram is an open system without gate barrier. To avoid fines, remember to tap your nol card/ticket on the validator before boarding and after alighting the Tram.

Note: For more details, the customer can check RTA Apps (RTA Dubai or S’hail).
fields.Process:
Tram stations (ticket vending machines)

  • The customer purchases a nol card (if he does not have a card)
  • If the card balance is not sufficient, the customer is required to top up (a minimum balance of AED 7.5) the balance to use the tram
  • The customer taps nol card on the validator before boarding and after alighting the Tram.


Note: For more details the customer can check nol website.
fields.Channels - Tram Stations:
Working hours

  • From Saturday to Thursday between 7:00 a.m. and 12 a.m.
  • Friday between 10 a.m. and 12 a.m.

Notes:

  • Working hours might change according to holidays and special events
  • For more details, customers can check the website of the Roads and Transport Authority (RTA).
fields.Eligibility: Individual customers of all ages are eligible to use the tram.
fields.Required Documents: This service has no required documents.
fields.Description:
This service enables you to travel between 11 stations that have been distributed on according to activity regions and to the population along the tram route. The tram passes through these stations:

  • Jumeirah Beach Residence Tram Station 1
  • Jumeirah Beach Residence Tram Station 2
  • Jumeirah Lakes Towers
  • Dubai Marina Mall
  • Dubai Marina
  • Marina Towers
  • Mina Seyahi
  • Media City
  • Palm Jumeirah
  • Knowledge Village
  • Al Sufouh.

Each tram consists of 7 cabins distributed as follows:

  • Gold class
  • Silver class
  • Private cabins for women and children
  • Special area in cabins for people of determination.

fields.Description:
This service enables you to benefit from scheduled trips by buying tickets for marine means of transport. It also enables you to commute between specific marine transport stations using a closed, air-conditioned cabin that has an area for people of determination.

The air-conditioned cabin is available on two vessels:

  • Water Bus: It is a modern vessel with WC and a small rental space that accommodates up to 23 passengers and a space for people of determination. It also has a small viewing deck at the end of the vessel that serves as a tourist attraction.
  • Air-conditioned Abra: This Abra accommodates up to 19 passengers and one area for people of determination. The air-conditioned Abra is known for providing the best ambiance throughout the year especially during the summer season.

Characteristics:

  • Comfortable seats and air-conditioned cabin.

name: Transport Using Taxi Vehicles

fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: Do taxi drivers accept coupons/company vouchers?

Answer 1: Taxi drivers accept coupons from the customer if they’re issued from Dubai taxi agency or from companies like Nissan showroom and others. If the taxi fees are higher than the amount of the coupon, the customer can settle the difference in cash.

Note: Values of coupons and vouchers vary according to events and exhibitions.

  • Question 2: What is payment method in Dubai Taxi?

Answer 2: The customer can settle taxi fees in cash, through the nol Card with an additional charge of 1 AED for using this method, through credit card with an additional charge of 2 AED for using this method.

  • Question 3: Can 2 customers with 2 different drop off destinations or locations share the same taxi?

Answer 3: Sharing a taxi is not allowed as per Dubai Taxi Agency policy.

  • Question 4: Are multiple pickups and drop-offs allowed?

Answer 4: Multiple pickups and drop offs are not allowed. For example, if a customer takes a taxi and decides to pick up or drop off a friend during the journey, the taxi driver must restart the counter.
fields.Process:
Through mobile application

  • The customer logs in to the app with the username and password
  • The customer selects “Booking a Taxi Vehicle” service
  • The customer enters the required details (his current location and the location he wants to reach)
  • The taxi heads to the customer’s location.

Through airport exits

  • The customer heads to the location where vehicles are parked in front of the exit door
  • The customer takes the taxi.

On the road

  • The customer waits on the road until a taxi passes.

fields.Description:
Dubai Metro is a driverless modern fully automated rail system with red and green lines.

Each line passes through a number of stations that are designed by architects and artists.

The stations have a variety of features for customers including retail outlets, Wi-Fi internet, ATM machines and other services for People of Determination. All services are linked to a wide network of other means of transport such as buses, taxis, and water buses.

The Red Line runs from Rashidiya station to UAE Exchange station. The line consists of 29 stations and provides free multi-storey vehicle parking for public transport users at the Rashidiya station, Nahkeel Harbour and Tower station.

The Green Line consists of 18 stations and runs from the Etisalat station which provides multi-storey vehicle parking and passes through the Dubai Healthcare City and Jaddaf area.

Passengers can transfer between the 2 lines either at the Union station or at the BurJuman station.

fields.FAQs:
• Question 1: What are the features of nol cards?

Answer 1: The features of nol cards are:

    • Easy to get
    • Easy to use and top up
    • The customer can use it for Dubai metro, public buses, Dubai water bus and RTA paid parking
    • Automatically calculates the cost of the trip and deducts it from the customer’s e-wallet
    • Low fare and easy transport through the different means of transportation.
  • Question 2: Where and how to use nol cards?
  • Answer 2:
  • Transportation Usage:
    • Metro: nol Card should be tapped on the metro gates before going in and out of the station.
    • Tram: nol Card should be tapped on the card reader machine prior to boarding and after getting-off the train.
    • Bus: nol cards must be tapped on the bus validators before boarding and alighting the bus.
    • Parking: nol Card must be inserted in parking meter machine to pay and get a ticket for the parking fees.
  • Non-Transport Usage:
    • Parks & Museum: nol card must be tapped on the card reader machine located at entrance gates of the park.
    • Micro-Payment: nol cards can be used as a payment for authorized sales agent by placing or tapping the card on the card reader machine.
fields.Output: Using nol cards.
fields.Service Fees: • No fees apply when using nol cards.
fields.Validity:
• nol Silver/Gold (Anonymous or Registered): 5 years Validity (it can be used for 2 years after its expiry date, and the customer can use the remaining balance without the ability to top up)
  • Personalized nol card (Blue card): 5 years Validity (it can be used for 2 years after its expiry date, and the customer can use the remaining balance without the ability to top up)
  • nol Red ticket: 90 days or 10 trips.
fields.Terms and Conditions:
• For customers using public transportation a minimum e-Wallet balance of AED 7.50 is required.
  • No minimum e-Wallet balance is required for customers using their cards at the Authorized Sales Agents (groceries, restaurants, petrol, parks…etc.).

fields.Description:
nol card is the only method of payment in Dubai Transport modes, and can also be used to pay many non-transport service as well.

Transportation Usage: nol cards are used as a means of payment in (metro, Tram, Taxi, Parking Meters, water Taxi & Buses).

Non-transport Usage: nol cards are used as a payment for authorized shops and Authorized sales agents (Grocery, Restaurants, Parks, and Petrol Station etc.).
